title: General
text: The credit allowable under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall not exceed $500,000 ($600,000 in the case of an eligible small business).

logical_structure.result: The credit allowable under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall not exceed $500,000 ($600,000 in the case of an eligible small business).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45F(b)(1)In General—The credit allowable under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall not exceed $500,000
                     ($600,000 in the case of an eligible small business).

title: Adjustment
text: In the case of any taxable year beginning after 2026, the $500,000 and $600,000 amounts in paragraph (1) shall each be increased by an amount equal to——such dollar amount, multiplied by—the cost-of-living adjustment determined undersection 1(f)(3)for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting ‘calendar year 2025’ for ‘calendar year 2016’ in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

logical_structure.result: In the case of any taxable year beginning after 2026, the $500,000 and $600,000 amounts in paragraph (1) shall each be increased by an amount equal to——such dollar amount, multiplied by—the cost-of-living adjustment determined undersection 1(f)(3)for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting ‘calendar year 2025’ for ‘calendar year 2016’ in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

I.R.C. § 45F(b)(2)Inflation Adjustment—In the case of any taxable year beginning after 2026, the $500,000 and $600,000 amounts
                     in paragraph (1) shall each be increased by an amount equal to—I.R.C. § 45F(b)(2)(A)—such dollar amount, multiplied byI.R.C. § 45F(b)(2)(B)—the cost-of-living adjustment determined undersection 1(f)(3)for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting
                        ‘calendar year 2025’ for ‘calendar year 2016’ in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

title: General
text: The term “qualified child care expenditure” means any amount paid or incurred——to acquire, construct, rehabilitate, or expand property——which is to be used as part of a qualified child care facility of the taxpayer,—with respect to which a deduction for depreciation (or amortization in lieu of depreciation) is allowable, and—which does not constitute part of the principal residence (within the meaning of section121) of the taxpayer or any employee of the taxpayer,—for the operating costs of a qualified child care facility of the taxpayer, including costs related to the training of employees, to scholarship programs, and to the providing of increased compensation to employees with higher levels of child care training, orEditor's Note:Sec. 45F(c)(1)(A)(iii), below, before amendment byPub. L. 119-21, Sec. 70401(d), is applicable to amounts paid or incurred on or before Dec. 31, 2025.—under a contract with a qualified child care facility to provide child care services to employees of the taxpayer.Editor's Note:Sec. 45F(c)(1)(A)(iii), below, after amendment byPub. L. 119-21, Sec. 70401(d), is applicable to amounts paid or incurred after Dec. 31, 2025.—under a contract with a qualified child care facility to provide child care services to employees of the taxpayer, or under a contract with an intermediate entity that contracts with one or more qualified child care facilities to provide such child care services.

logical_structure.result: The term “qualified child care expenditure” means any amount paid or incurred——to acquire, construct, rehabilitate, or expand property——which is to be used as part of a qualified child care facility of the taxpayer,—with respect to which a deduction for depreciation (or amortization in lieu of depreciation) is allowable, and—which does not constitute part of the principal residence (within the meaning of section121) of the taxpayer or any employee of the taxpayer,—for the operating costs of a qualified child care facility of the taxpayer, including costs related to the training of employees, to scholarship programs, and to the providing of increased compensation to employees with higher levels of child care training, orEditor's Note:Sec. 45F(c)(1)(A)(iii), below, before amendment byPub. L. 119-21, Sec. 70401(d), is applicable to amounts paid or incurred on or before Dec. 31, 2025.—under a contract with a qualified child care facility to provide child care services to employees of the taxpayer.Editor's Note:Sec. 45F(c)(1)(A)(iii), below, after amendment byPub. L. 119-21, Sec. 70401(d), is applicable to amounts paid or incurred after Dec. 31, 2025.—under a contract with a qualified child care facility to provide child care services to employees of the taxpayer, or under a contract with an intermediate entity that contracts with one or more qualified child care facilities to provide such child care services.

title: Market Value
text: The term “qualified child care expenditures” shall not include expenses in excess of the fair market value of such care.

logical_structure.result: The term “qualified child care expenditures” shall not include expenses in excess of the fair market value of such care.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45F(c)(1)(B)Fair Market Value—The term “qualified child care expenditures” shall not include expenses in excess
                        of the fair market value of such care.

title: General
text: The term “qualified child care facility” means a facility——the principal use of which is to provide child care assistance, and—which meets the requirements of all applicable laws and regulations of the State or local government in which it is located, including the licensing of the facility as a child care facility.Clause(i)shall not apply to a facility which is the principal residence (within the meaning of section121) of the operator of the facility.

logical_structure.result: The term “qualified child care facility” means a facility——the principal use of which is to provide child care assistance, and—which meets the requirements of all applicable laws and regulations of the State or local government in which it is located, including the licensing of the facility as a child care facility.Clause(i)shall not apply to a facility which is the principal residence (within the meaning of section121) of the operator of the facility.

                           local government in which it is located, including the licensing of the facility as
                           a child care facility.Clause(i)shall not apply to a facility which is the principal residence (within the meaning
                           of section121) of the operator of the facility.

title: Rules With Respect To A Taxpayer
text: A facility shall not be treated as a qualified child care facility with respect to a taxpayer unless——enrollment in the facility is open to employees of the taxpayer during the taxable year,—if the facility is the principal trade or business of the taxpayer, at least 30 percent of the enrollees of such facility are dependents of employees of the taxpayer, and—the use of such facility (or the eligibility to use such facility) does not discriminate in favor of employees of the taxpayer who are highly compensated employees (within the meaning of section414(q)).
conditions: the facility is the principal trade or business of the taxpayer, at least 30 percent of the enrollees of such facility are dependents of employees of the taxpayer, and—the use of such facility (or the eligibility to use such facility) does not discriminate in favor of employees of the taxpayer who are highly compensated employees (within the meaning of section414(q)).
——enrollment in the facility is open to employees of the taxpayer during the taxable year,—

if: the facility is the principal trade or business of the taxpayer, at least 30 percent of the enrollees of such facility are dependents of employees of the taxpayer, and—the use of such facility (or the eligibility to use such facility) does not discriminate in favor of employees of the taxpayer who are highly compensated employees (within the meaning of section414(q)).
unless: ——enrollment in the facility is open to employees of the taxpayer during the taxable year,—
logical_structure.result: A facility shall not be treated as a qualified child care facility with respect to a taxpayer

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45F(c)(2)(B)Special Rules With Respect To A Taxpayer—A facility shall not be treated as a qualified child care facility with respect to
                        a taxpayer unless—I.R.C. § 45F(c)(2)(B)(i)—enrollment in the facility is open to employees of the taxpayer during the taxable
                           year,I.R.C. § 45F(c)(2)(B)(ii)—if the facility is the principal trade or business of the taxpayer, at least 30 percent
                           of the enrollees of such facility are dependents of employees of the taxpayer, andI.R.C. § 45F(c)(2)(B)(iii)—the use of such facility (or the eligibility to use such facility) does not discriminate
                           in favor of employees of the taxpayer who are highly compensated employees (within
                           the meaning of section414(q)).

title: Of Jointly Owned or Operated Child Care Facility
text: A facility shall not fail to be treated as a qualified child care facility of the taxpayer merely because such facility is jointly owned or operated by the taxpayer and other persons.

logical_structure.result: A facility shall not fail to be treated as a qualified child care facility of the taxpayer merely because such facility is jointly owned or operated by the taxpayer and other persons.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45F(c)(2)(C)Treatment Of Jointly Owned or Operated Child Care Facility—A facility shall not fail to be treated as a qualified child care facility of the
                        taxpayer merely because such facility is jointly owned or operated by the taxpayer
                        and other persons.

title: General
text: The term “qualified child care resource and referral expenditure” means any amount paid or incurred under a contract to provide child care resource and referral services to an employee of the taxpayer.

logical_structure.result: The term “qualified child care resource and referral expenditure” means any amount paid or incurred under a contract to provide child care resource and referral services to an employee of the taxpayer.

                        to an employee of the taxpayer.

                        of the taxpayer who are highly compensated employees (within the meaning of section414(q)).

title: Small Business
text: The term ‘eligible small business’ means a business that meets the gross receipts test of section448(c), determined——by substituting ‘5-taxable-year’ for ‘3-taxable-year’ in paragraph (1) thereof, and—by substituting ‘5-year’ for ‘3-year’ in paragraph (3)(A) thereof.

title: General
text: If, as of the close of any taxable year, there is a recapture event with respect to any qualified child care facility of the taxpayer, then the tax of the taxpayer under this chapter for such taxable year shall be increased by an amount equal to the product of——the applicable recapture percentage, and—the aggregate decrease in the credits allowed under section38for all prior taxable years which would have resulted if the qualified child care expenditures of the taxpayer described in subsection(c)(1)(A)with respect to such facility had been zero.

title: To Assume Recapture Liability
text: Clause(i)shall not apply if the person acquiring such interest in the facility agrees in writing to assume the recapture liability of the person disposing of such interest in effect immediately before such disposition. In the event of such an assumption, the person acquiring the interest in the facility shall be treated as the taxpayer for purposes of assessing any recapture liability (computed as if there had been no change in ownership).

In the event of such an assumption, the person acquiring the interest in the facility shall be treated as the taxpayer for purposes of assessing any recapture liability (computed as
there had been no change in ownership).

title: Benefit Rule
text: The tax for the taxable year shall be increased under paragraph(1)only with respect to credits allowed by reason of this section which were used to reduce tax liability. In the case of credits not so used to reduce tax liability, the carryforwards and carrybacks under section39shall be appropriately adjusted.

In the case of credits not so used to reduce tax liability, the carryforwards and carrybacks under section39shall be appropriately adjusted.

                        reduce tax liability. In the case of credits not so used to reduce tax  liability,
                        the carryforwards and carrybacks under section39shall be  appropriately adjusted.

title: Credits Against Tax
text: Any increase in tax under this subsection shall not be treated as a tax imposed by this chapter for purposes of determining the amount of any credit under this chapter or for purposes of section55.

logical_structure.result: Any increase in tax under this subsection shall not be treated as a tax imposed by this chapter for purposes of determining the amount of any credit under this chapter or for purposes of section55.

                        by this chapter for purposes of determining the amount of any  credit under this chapter
                        or for purposes of section55.

title: Recapture By Reason Of Casualty Loss
text: The increase in tax under this subsection shall not apply to a cessation of operation of the facility as a qualified child care facility by reason of a casualty loss to the extent such loss is restored by reconstruction or replacement within a reasonable period established by the Secretary.

logical_structure.result: The increase in tax under this subsection shall not apply to a cessation of operation of the facility as a qualified child care facility by reason of a casualty loss to the extent such loss is restored by reconstruction or replacement within a reasonable period established by the Secretary.

I.R.C. § 45F(d)(4)(C)No Recapture By Reason Of Casualty Loss—The  increase in tax under this subsection shall not apply to a cessation of  operation
                        of the facility as a qualified child care facility by reason of  a casualty loss to
                        the extent such loss is restored by reconstruction or  replacement within a reasonable
                        period established by the  Secretary.

title: Rules
text: All persons which are treated as a single employer under subsections(a)and(b)of section52shall be treated as a single taxpayer.

logical_structure.result: All persons which are treated as a single employer under subsections(a)and(b)of section52shall be treated as a single taxpayer.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 45F(e)(1)Aggregation Rules—All  persons which are treated as a single employer under subsections(a)and(b)of section52shall be treated as a single taxpayer.

title: In The Case Of Estates And Trusts
text: Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, rules similar to the rules of subsection(d)of section52shall apply.

logical_structure.result: Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, rules similar to the rules of subsection(d)of section52shall apply.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 45F(e)(2)Pass-Thru In The Case Of Estates And Trusts—Under  regulations prescribed by the Secretary, rules similar to the rules of  subsection(d)of section52shall apply.

title: In The Case Of Partnerships
text: In the case of partnerships, the credit shall be allocated among partners under regulations prescribed by the Secretary.

title: General
text: If a credit is determined under this section with respect to any property by reason of expenditures described in subsection(c)(1)(A), the basis of such property shall be reduced by the amount of the credit so determined.

                        of expenditures described in subsection(c)(1)(A), the basis of
                        such property shall be reduced by the amount of the credit so  determined.

title: Dispositions
text: If, during any taxable year, there is a recapture amount determined with respect to any property the basis of which was reduced under subparagraph(A), the basis of such property (immediately before the event resulting in such recapture) shall be increased by an amount equal to such recapture amount. For purposes of the preceding sentence, the term “recapture amount” means any increase in tax (or adjustment in carrybacks or carryovers) determined under subsection(d).

title: Deductions And Credits
text: No deduction or credit shall be allowed under any other provision of this chapter with respect to the amount of the credit determined under this section.

logical_structure.result: No deduction or credit shall be allowed under any other provision of this chapter with respect to the amount of the credit determined under this section.

I.R.C. § 45F(f)(2)Other Deductions And Credits—No  deduction or credit shall be allowed under any other provision of this  chapter
                     with respect to the amount of the credit determined under this  section.

title: and Guidance
text: The Secretary shall issue such regulations or other guidance as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this section, including guidance to carry out the purposes of paragraphs (1)(A)(iii) and (2)(C) of subsection (c).

logical_structure.result: The Secretary shall issue such regulations or other guidance as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this section, including guidance to carry out the purposes of paragraphs (1)(A)(iii) and (2)(C) of subsection (c).
